text:
Apr 25
Lunch 3 of us

First time eating at this branch.

Layout and ambience ok. Cleanliness good. It s work day so not too crowded.

Service attentive and prompt. Though all orders using apps but they still help with questions.

Foods and drinks:
- the galao is nice especially if you are looking for something non sugar.
- the new menu honey thigh chicken bowl also very nice. Adequate portion with good sides add ons
- sweet potato fries just too yummy cant stop once you start

Overall it is very nice and a good option if you are hungry at bugis junction mall.

The three of us had the two piece thigh and the meal for two.  The chicken and all the sides taste good.  The meal for two comes with two free flow drinks.  So we need to pay extra for another drink.

The staff were friendly and provided pretty fast service.
It's very delicious, though slightly pricey (speaking as a student). I enjoyed the sweet potato fries a lot (not pictured). It's a nice place to share a meal with friends and/or family!

Nando's Bugis Junction â€“ Where Chickens Go on a Diet Before Serving

We went to Nandoâ€™s at Bugis Junction with stomachs rumbling and expectations high, hoping for a hearty, soul-warming meal. After all, when youâ€™re forking out $16.30 for boneless chicken thighs, youâ€™d expect at least, wellâ€¦ a decent amount of chicken. Right?

What arrived at the table looked like something youâ€™d find hiding behind the lettuce in a sad school lunchbox. The so-called "chicken thighs" couldâ€™ve passed for chicken thoughtsâ€”small, fleeting, and barely there. Blink and you might miss them. Or maybe that was the point: a culinary magic trick. Now you see it, now you're still hungry.

Letâ€™s be clear. For $16.30, I wasnâ€™t expecting a whole farmyard experience, but I also wasnâ€™t expecting appetizers for ants. Honestly, Iâ€™ve had more meat fall off a KFC drumstick I dropped on the floor.

The photos speak for themselves, but just to paint the picture: imagine paying steakhouse prices and receiving a snack-sized portion that would leave even a toddler asking, â€œIs that all?â€ At this point, Iâ€™d have had a more fulfilling experience (emotionally and nutritionally) at a fast food chainâ€”and still walked away with change for dessert.

In conclusion: if you're looking to pay premium prices for portion sizes that would make a hamster complain, Nandoâ€™s Bugis Junction is your spot. Otherwise, save your dollars and your dignity. You deserve a meal, not a mystery.
